People seem to forget the generational super star that is Nicholas Cage. If you are a fan of national treasure look no further as the ghost rider does it again. The innovative genius of first person POV fight scenes, the thrilling nature of the alien chase scenes and the suspenseful will they wont they of the asian and caucasian main characters left me on the edge of my seat. The only disappointment you will feel from this movie is the dread that you will never be able to experience for the first time again.

I love you Nick keep it up.

review_title: Jiu Jitsu...Nic Cage...Tony Jaa...? I Had Exceedingly High Expectations
review_detailed_main:
Yes indeed! Jiu Jitsu, Nic Cage, Tony Jaa...this is just one film were talking about here! There are other words I could write or more actors I could name, etc., that pertain to this film, but the expectations are already through the roof! Or, at least, those three bits of information worked into one Cinematic equation, for me... I had exceedingly high expectations, as anyone who has regularly watched films over the last few decades would.

For the most part, I would say that Jiu Jitsu does deliver pretty effectively -- it is an absolute joy to watch; I don't think there are too many that are going to deny that!

Unfortunately, & why I give it only a 7/10 -- Jiu Jitsu was just never going to meet my expectations; it is truly an attempt to make the impossible film, I think. At least for Human Beings anyway; I mean, who knows? With all this fantastic work that generative AI has been able to produce in just the last 6 months, maybe someday soon it will be able to merge Nic Cage & Tony Jaa into one Super-Actor & create scenes no one has ever conceived of before that somehow makes the impossible film become possible...(?)

Bad movies are not all the same, shame on you cinephiles, voting down a near masterpiece. You do not get it? Let me badxplain it to you... easy with a comparison: take "A wrinkle in time", an Oprah vanity project infused with mountains of Disney cash, horrible acting paired with pretentious nonsense script and a "woke" director that is in way over her head. Journalists and sites artificially maintaining the vote high because of spineless conformism. THAT is a 3 or 4 out of 10, only because the technical departments did their job. The viewers pay full price and believe the hype and ultimately are the victim.

Now, only now, let's have a look at JIU JITSU, the cash is bare minimum, camera is terrible, sound is barely decent, the acting is either desperate attempt to save face or straight horrible: the production is cutting so many corners that they end up with a sphere, the perfect solid. It's sooooo bad that it goes straight to the other side. This film is a monster, in the latin original sense: monstrum, itself derived from the verb moneo ("to remind, warn, instruct, or foretell"), and denotes anything "strange or singular, contrary to the usual course of nature". A marvel of nature, you cannot plan for this stuff: is the collective result of C-List actors desperate for cash and an improvised crew, improbable production standards and a weird 3rd rewrite of the script for a grand total of 7 (!) bucks ticket. That would be enough for a 6,5/7 but... it's got (Oscar winner) Nicolas Cage, the myth. It's a straight 8!!! (and if you stiff upper lips fake connoisseurs don't get it, rewatch some of your beloved pretentious crap and stick to that).

PS It's not perfect because nobody died during production as far as we know.

I enjoyed it. Not the best anything, but very entertaining. Expected more Tony Jaa, but it was good. People who rated it negatively were judging off of what they thought it was gonna be. Not what it was. Will be awesome if Mystery Science Theater 3000 gets a hold of it. It's a movie for guys who like movies! 🍿
Can't understand the rating. Marie Avgeropoulos played amazing.
Greatest movie ever made Nic Cage makes it 1000X better

The movie is about martial arts And there is an abundance of fighting scenes in it. It is not for people who do not like martial art movies. I loved watching all the fight scenes. They were intense. Now the plot is a bit absurd and not realistic BUT it compensates you with great martial art scenes and that is what I wanted to watch.

review_title: Fun, silly, and full of action
review_detailed_main: As an martial art film fan, I love this movie. Jiu Jitsu definitely is a mindless, fun, silly, crazy film with great action scenes. My favorites are JuJu Chan and Tony Jaa's fights. Honestly, it's time for a female lead action film with JuJu. Only complaint, I wanted more of her and Tony in the film...

review_title: Realy funny and lots of jiu jitsu! CHECK IT OUT FOR YOUR SELF! Dont look at the revieuws.
review_detailed_main:
It was a realy fun movie. During the fights you forget it is a b-quality movie. The budget was rather small but i absolutley love the fighting scenes. And there are lots of them.

And for the People that say there is no jiu jitsu. In my family we have 3 jiu jitsu fighters. And there are so many parts that where real jiu jitsu moves.

Do you like fighting movies? Watch this!

Do you like to have a good evening? Watch this!

It is just fun! Dont expect it to be the best movie you ever seen? But it is fun. And you will laugh. Makes you watch the whole movie!

Oh and Cage is in the movie with some awsome call outs.

GO WATCH IT! And see for your self.

Get your popcorn ready, relax, and enjoy the kind of science fiction, action adventure, martial arts movie that audiences have been missing for so long. Jiu Jitsu delivers on the world class martial arts, off the wall story, special effects, and environmental design that has been missing from the genre for so long. Legendary martial artists like Tony Jaa and Alain Moussi join forces with the impossibly charismatic Nicolas Cage to bring the world of Jiu Jitsu to life, and its a world I hope we can return to in a sequel one day. The story grabs you tight from the first moments and doesn't let go until the very end, whipping you through an intricate world of action adventure excitement. Jiu Jitsu is good old fashioned moviegoing fun, and it will satisfy the wide eyed kid in all of us. Highly recommend.

Look, it's not a perfect movie exploring the depths of human emotion. What it is a good no-brainer action movie that can be enjoyed for its filmography, special effects, ambitious action scenes and small details.

The plot is an enjoyable mix of other cult classics with some added twists and turns.

Cage actually really suits the role, and some some of the tongue in cheek dialogue and easter eggs will sadly be lost on most viewers.

I'm glad i rented this movie and appreciate it for it's details. I will be buying this movie at a later date to support the cast and crew.

Appreciate it for what it is, 8/10

I almost didn't watch this due to ratings. However I love action SciFi supernatural cheesy movies i.e mortal Kombat 95. This was great! Not worth the 10 I gave but it hits a certain type of person in the right way. I love ainto the Badlands, Monster Hunter, etc for similar reasons. Don't overthink it just enjoy! I hate that so many SciFi movies also horror get such low ratings from online cry babies.

review_title: The Next Evolution in Film Making.
review_detailed_main: How could it be anything else? It juat had everything of the 'worst' kind in one film. That itself is a monumental feat in film making.
This movie was good Nicolas cage and the rest of the cast did awesome, nothing but a good martial arts flick
Nice movie good movie please support movie maker in times of pandemic

If you wanted Predator mixed with Ip Man, this is definitely going to be one you'll want to see. Nicolas Cage's performance itself is worth the watch considering he goes full Cage crazy in this film while still keeping you interested in the overall story. The camera work during the fight scenes are decent, no bad shaking. Acting was a very good surprise, this was a very well put together cast. All in all, I would definitely re-watch.

If you expect Jiu Jitsu lessons you will be very disappointed. If you want some deep lesson in life or understanding of a foreign culture, nope. If you want to see an aging Nicolas Cage and some fast paced, well choreographed fight scene, after fight scene in a mindless, disjointed story with some alien who is the bad guy, that originally brought Jiu Jitsu to the heroes, that have to get totally whooped by him, to death, every 6 years.... then you will NOT be disappointed.

As a fan of both Nicolas Cage and Alain Moussi, I loved it. Original storytelling, diverse cast, beautiful scenery, and awesome fight scenes. If you want to see good kick evil's ass in a battle for our planet I recommend Jiu Jitsu.

I'm a huge fan of Martial Arts films. I've been doing Jiu Jitsu my entire life and I should say this movie is amazing. I enjoyed every single part of it. I am also a huge fan of Rigan Machado and I was so gladly surprised seeing him in this movie.

Jiu Jitsu is a really good martial arts action movie I've seen in a long time, and having Nicolas Cage and Frank Grillo is icing on the cake. The film is essentially a knockoff of The Bourne Identity and Predator. The fight scenes are exceptionally well done, and even Cage gets in on some of the fight action. Jiu Jitsu is certainly worth checking out. Entertaining movie with great action sequences that martial arts movie fans will definitely love. Put on some popcorn and enjoy.
Fun to watch, amazing fight scenes. Nicolas Cage had some cool action scene. Alain Moussi keeps on getting better, this was truly his best all around movie up to day!

review_title: The movie title that fails to deliver
